pageContext.claim: “We hadn't had auto plants built in many, many years. And now we're having many in Michigan, in Ohio, in Pennsylvania, in Florida, in North Carolina, South Carolina. Many, many plants are being built and being expanded. And that was not happening. Our auto companies and many companies were leaving the United States. Now they're staying.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often claims that car plants are being built in several swing states he would need to win reelection in 2020. Although some automakers have announced new plants or expansions in Michigan, Ohio and South Carolina, there's little or no evidence for the other swing states Trump mentions. And it's not true plants had not been built before he came into office.
